Package rummy

Class RummyState

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.GameState
      • rummy.RummyState
  • public final class RummyState
extends GameState
    Defines the state of the game. This class is constantly updated and passed between players.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • RummyState

        public RummyState​(java.util.Stack<Card> stock,
                  java.util.Stack<Card> discard,
                  java.util.Vector<java.util.Vector<Card>> hands,
                  java.util.Vector<java.util.Vector<Card>> melds,
                  java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> newChatHistory,
                  int currentPlayer,
                  java.util.Vector<rummy.Move> moves,
                  int[] score)
        Constructor for creating a new state.
        Parameters:
        stock - the deck in the center.
        discard - the deck of discarded cards in the center.
        hands - Vector containing all the hands of all players.
        melds - Vector containing Vector's, which represent melds in play.
        newChatHistory - Vector containing all the chats
        currentPlayer - integer to keep track of whose turn it is.
        moves - Vector of moves.
        score - array containing scores of each player.

      • getMeld

        public java.util.Vector<Card> getMeld​(int index)
        Return melds for Rummy game.Unlike the number of hands, the number of melds is variable. Therefore, this method will return null in the case the index is outside the range of melds.
        Parameters:
        index -
        Returns:
        the meld at the index, else null
